definition: to submerge/to immerse/to sink/to keep down/to lower/to drop/deep/profound/heavy
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: The rising prices are hitting consumers hard as well.
sentences.chinese: 物價上漲也對消費者造成沉重打擊。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, many Western banks also have been hit hard.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，許多歐美銀行也遭受沉重打擊。

sentences.english: The scrutiny has resulted in a big public-relations hit to the company in China.
sentences.chinese: 這些質疑給沃爾瑪在中國的公關形象造成沉重打擊。

sentences.english: This explosive bomb directed against the native money-landlords brought forth a bitter reaction.
sentences.chinese: 對本地地主老財的這種沉重打擊，引起了強烈的反應。

sentences.english: These all give the rural economy serious attack, the farmer leaves the village phenomenon to he serious.
sentences.chinese: 這些都給農村經濟沉重打擊，農民離村現象嚴重。

sentences.english: It can hurt your ego, and financially it’s a big hit.
sentences.chinese: 它會傷害你的自尊，經濟上也會遭受沉重打擊。
